data_description.api_key: The provided API key will be used to authenticate requests to the Perplexity AI service. It is of the form: pplx-XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

user.description: In order to use the Perplexity Assistant, you need to generate an API key via [Perplexity](https://www.perplexity.ai/account/api/keys).

data_description.model: Select the model to be used for the Perplexity Assistant. Associated costs may vary depending on the chosen model (for more information: [API Cost](https://github.com/Pekulll/Perplexity-Assistant?tab=readme-ov-file#3-api-cost)).
data_description.language: Choose the language in which the Perplexity Assistant will respond.
data_description.custom_system_prompt: Provide custom instructions to guide the behavior of the Perplexity Assistant for each request.

model.description: You can customize the model, language, and add a custom system prompt for the Perplexity Assistant.

data_description.max_tokens: Limits the length of the assistant's response in number of tokens.
data_description.creativity: Controls the level of creativity in responses. Lower values (near 0.1) produce more factual responses; higher values (near 0.9) generate more creative ones.
data_description.diversity: Adjusts diversity of generated responses. Lower values (near 0.1) are more focused; higher values (near 0.9) increase diversity.
data_description.frequency_penalty: Reduces repetition in responses. Higher values (near 1.0) penalize repetition more; lower values (near 0.0) do not.

model_parameters.description: Customize model parameters to fine-tune the assistant's behavior.

data.allow_entities_access: Allow access to Home Assistant entities
data.allow_actions_on_entities: Allow actions on Home Assistant entities
data.enable_web_search: Enable web search for up-to-date information
data.notify_response: Notify each response to a query
data.enable_response_on_speakers: Enable responses to be played through speakers

data_description.allow_entities_access: Allows the Perplexity Assistant to access entities from your Home Assistant instance to provide more contextual responses.
data_description.entities_summary_refresh_rate: Sets how often the Perplexity Assistant updates the summary of Home Assistant entities' states (in seconds).
data_description.allow_actions_on_entities: Allows the Perplexity Assistant to perform actions on Home Assistant entities, such as turning on lights or adjusting the thermostat.
data_description.enable_web_search: Enables the Perplexity Assistant's ability to perform web searches for up-to-date information, although this may sometimes reduce response relevance.
data_description.notify_response: If enabled, the Perplexity Assistant will notify you of each response it generates.
data_description.enable_response_on_speakers: Allows the Perplexity Assistant to play responses through speakers connected to Home Assistant, provided TTS is configured and Perplexity can precisely locate you.
data_description.tts_engine: Select the TTS engine to be used for voice responses.

authorization.description: Define the authorizations and permissions for the Perplexity Assistant.

error.invalid_api_key: The provided API key is invalid. Please check and try again.
error.invalid_api_key_length: The provided API key must be exactly 53 characters long. Please check and try again.
error.max_length_exceeded: The custom system prompt must not exceed 250 characters. Please shorten it and try again.
error.cannot_connect: Unable to connect to Perplexity AI service. Please check your internet connection and try again.
error.unknown: An unknown error occurred. Please try again later.

abort.single_instance_allowed: Only a single instance of Perplexity Assistant is allowed.
